summary: The Global Investment in American Jobs Act of 2025 directs the Secretary of Commerce to conduct an interagency review on increasing U.S. global competitiveness in attracting foreign direct investment from responsible private sector entities based in trusted countries. The review will assess economic impacts, trends in investment, government policies, challenges from State-owned enterprises, and relevant best practices. It will also consider the impact of protectionist policies and other barriers in a digital economy. The Secretary must submit a report to Congress with recommendations within a year after enactment, following opportunities for public comment.
